thread.title: Churchill, Kentucky Downs reach 2016 September dates agreement
thread.title_full: Churchill, Kentucky Downs reach 2016 September dates agreement

author: courier-journal.com
title: Churchill, Kentucky Downs reach 2016 September dates agreement
text:
Pending Kentucky Horse Racing Commission approval Monday, Churchill Downs and Kentucky Downs have agreed to avoid a racing dates overlap in 2016.
Churchill spokesman Darren Rogers said Friday the Louisville track will card an 11-day meet beginning Sept. 16 and ending Oct. 2, while Kentucky Downs in Franklin, Ky., will wrap up its live racing on Sept. 15.
"After having a really good discussion with the other tracks," Rogers said, "we think we've come up with a really good schedule for the month of September that'll benefit the Kentucky horsemen and racing fans alike."
Churchill Downs will be open Friday-Sunday on its first weekend, then Thursday-Sunday the following two in September 2016. Twilight Thursday post times will return, Rogers said, and the track will host a "Downs After Dark" evening Sept. 24.
At a Kentucky Horse Racing Commission committee earlier this month, a lawyer representing Churchill Downs and Keeneland argued that the all-turf boutique meet took away from fields elsewhere in the state. Kentucky Downs attracts large numbers and purses thanks to revenues from instant racing machines installed at the track.
For next year, Kentucky Downs also requested seven racing days, up from five in 2015.
